bill_title: provide for the reconfiguration of the South Dakota sex offender registry to facilitate enhanced utilization by the public.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for the reconfiguration of the South Dakota sex offender registry to facilitate enhanced utilization by the public. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. The Office of the Attorney General shall review the form and style in which information is provided to the public in the South Dakota sex offender registry to determine the feasibility, cost, and desirability of reconfiguring the presentation of the data to facilitate enhanced utilization by the public. Special consideration should be directed to providing a search function or a system of flagging or segregating information that will facilitate the efficient identification of child molesters, pedophiles, and other threats to children. The Office of the Attorney General shall report its findings to the standing Judiciary Committees at the request of either chair during the 2011 Legislative Session. 180 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.052 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
